DOC.brief_summary: With early screening and appropriate iron supplementation, iron deficiency in the first year of life can be prevented in breastfed infants.
DOC.brief_title: Prevention of Iron Deficiency in Breastfed Infants
DOC.detailed_description: Infants with low ferritin at 1 month are at high risk of iron deficiency. They will receive iron drops starting at 2 months. All other infants are at low risk of iron deficiency. All infants will receive iron-fortified cereal starting at 4 months of age.
DOC.criteria: Term infants gestational age 3742 weeks birth weight > 2500 g exclusively breastfed at 28 d of age intend to breast feed until 9 mo of age supplemental formula before 4 mo of age
